who.title: Kim jestem?
who.subtitle: Tw贸rca ScreenToGif
who.part1: Cze ,nazywam si Nicke Manarin, jestem {0}-letnim developerem z Brazylii.
who.part2: Tworz oprogramowanie od 2012 roku, co rozpoczo si poprzez ch poprawienia swojej wiedzy zdobytej podczas studiowania.
who.part3: Po ukoczeniu studi贸w w 2016 roku, stale zdobywaem nowe umiejtnoci, kt贸re maj bezporednie zastosowanie w trakcie tworzenia moich projekt贸w.
who.part4: Chc spr贸bowa wszystkiego co w mojej mocy, aby tworzy oprogramowanie, kt贸re jest przydatne i atwe w u偶yciu.

why.title: Dlaczego powstao ScreenToGif?
why.subtitle: Historia powstania programu
why.part1: Projekt powsta w pa藕dzierniku 2013 roku jako m贸j spos贸b nauczenia si programowania, jednoczenie bdc narzdziem, kt贸re mi si przyda.
why.part2: Uczyem si jak projektowa GUI (i miaem z tym problemy), wic pomylaem, 偶e dobrze by byo mie jakie nagrania ekranu, co pomogoby mi zadawa pytania na forach.
why.part3: While some apps already existed, they didn't provide the specific feature that I needed, which prompted me to build my own solution (not realizing it would require a lot of work).
why.part4: The name 'ScreenToGif' is as simple as I guessed the tool would be: a screen recorder that exported as gif. It was supposed to be an easy to remember name.
why.part5: But I had no foreshadowing powers: The only part of the name that stays relevant is the middle 'To', as the app can now capture more than the screen and export to other formats.
why.part6: This project had a complete restart in 2016, after having issues for some months with the old platform, I ended up switching to a new one.
why.part7: This transition allowed me to develop more features, with easier to understand user interfaces.
why.part8: Although I'm the creator and maintainer of this project, other users also contribute with bug reports, feature requests and translations. Feel free to leave your comment. :)

features.title: Features
features.subtitle: See what you can do with ScreenToGif

recorders.title: Recorders
recorders.text1: Use ScreenToGif to record your screen, your webcam feed or sketch board drawings.

screen.title: Screen
screen.text1: Use the record, pause, discard or stop buttons to control your capture.
screen.text2: Select the capture frequency mode (manual, normal in fps, timelapse in fpm/fph).

older.title: Older UI
older.text1: Drag or resize the window to adjust what you want to capture.
older.text2: Type the exact size of the capture region.
older.text3: Drag the crosshair button and drop it on top of a window to move the recorder to capture that.

newer.title: Newer UI
newer.text1: Enter selection mode, which lets you select a region, a window or an entire screen to capture.

webcam.title: Webcam
webcam.text1: Use the record, pause, discard or stop buttons to control your capture.
webcam.text2: Select the maximum FPS of the capture.
webcam.text3: Resize the window to adjust the size of the capture.

sketchboard.title: Sketch board
sketchboard.text1: Enable the auto-capture or press Ctrl to toggle (pauses or captures it, depending if the auto-capture is enabled or disabled).
sketchboard.text2: Select the maximum FPS of the capture.
sketchboard.text3: Resize the window to adjust the size of the capture.

file.title: File
file.text1: Start a new recording or open a media (videos or images) or project file.
file.text2: Insert a new recording or media file (videos or images) into an existing project.

basic.title: Basic controls
basic.text1: Undo, redo or reset your edits.
basic.text3: Select multiple frames or browse to a specific frame.
basic.text4: Preview the playback of the animation.

frame.title: Frame manipulation
frame.text4: Delete all previous or all next frames.
frame.text5: Reverse, apply yoyo (forwards and backwards) or move frames around.
frame.text6: Alter the delay of the frames (override, increase/decrease or scale).

image.title: Image manipulation
image.text8: Cinemagraph (select parts of the animation to stay static or move).

app.title: Application
app.text2: Choose among 4 color themes (from light to very dark).
app.text3: Alter the system tray icon behavior (clicks to open parts of the app).
app.text4: Decide whether the app should update itself automatically (translation updates can be toggled too).

recorder.title: Recorder
recorder.text1: Select if you want the older or newer UI for the screen recorder.
recorder.text2: Choose which capture mode to use (BitBlt, DirectX, with memory cache or not).
recorder.text3: Select the capture frequency mode (manual, normal, timelapse).
recorder.text4: Enable cursor following (the recorder will follow your cursor during the recording).

editor.title: Editor
editor.text1: Select the previewer style (color and size of the background grid).
editor.text2: Enable the auto-sizing of the editor window based on the content size and vice-versa.
editor.text3: Options to enable confirmation dialogs before important actions.
editor.text4: Option to limit the undo/redo stack.

tasks.title: Tasks
tasks.text1: You can create tasks to apply effects to your recording, so that you don't need to manually apply them every time.

shortcuts.title: Shortcuts
shortcuts.text1: Set keyboard shortcuts to open the recorders and editor.
shortcuts.text2: You can also set shortcuts to control your recordings (record, pause, stop, and others).

language.title: Language
language.text2: The app will automatically select a language, based on your current OS settings.

storage.title: Storage
storage.text1: Control how the app store its data.
storage.text2: Recover used space by deleting old projects.

how-to-use.title: How to use?
how-to-use.subtitle: Learn how to use ScreenToGif
how-to-use.more: Click here to read more about how to use ScreenToGif

list.startup: When the app starts, click on the Recorder button.
list.record: A punctured window will appear, line up to what you want to record and click on Record. When finished, click on the Stop button.
list.edit-remove: Remove unwanted frames by selecting them with Shift-Click and pressing Delete.
list.edit-transition: Add a transition to the last frame, so the animation loops more smoothly.
list.edit-save: After your touch ups, click on Save As to export the animation to your format of choice.
list.final-gif: Here's the result Gif, around 80.6 KiB.

share.text: ScreenToGif is a screen, webcam and sketch board recorder with an integrated editor.
share.disclaimer: Would you like to not have your tweet linked on this page? Contact me

source.title: Source code
source.subtitle: ScreenToGif is open source!

links.website-info: The source code of this website

privacy-terms.title: Privacy and terms
privacy-terms.subtitle: And other technical details about ScreenToGif

software.title: The software
software.phrase1: ScreenToGif does not collect or transmit any personal (or system related) information without the user consent.
software.phrase2: In fact, the only way that ScreenToGif sends personal or system related data happens when the user sends us a feedback via the Feedback tool.
software.phrase3: The personal information may be provided by the users (such as their name and e-mail).
software.phrase4: The system related information is captured automatically by the Feedback tool in order to facilitate solving possible issues.
software.more: Click here to read more about other possible network connections opened by the software.

website.title: This website
website.phrase1: This website uses Google Analytics services, which collects session data about every pageview.
website.phrase2: The data is used only to understand better the public behavior towards this tool.

terms.title: Terms
terms.phrase1: ScreenToGif is free for use for everyone, even in corporate environments.
terms.more: You can read more about it here.
